text:
Most Maven goals are available as CLI commands using yupiik-tools-cli.
It is a plain Java application but you can also download the fatjar jar which is executable: java -cp yupiik-tools-cli-$version-fatjar.jar <args>.
title: CLI

lvl2:
Chain plugins
PDF and latex formula
Pom-less PDF rendering
Minisite
Bash CLI skeleton
Maven Asciidoctor Macro
Yupiik OSS extension
Inline pom contributor extension
lvl3:
Confluence Limitations
Blog
Pre-Action
Example
Page attributes
Index generation
Synchronize Releases Example
Usage
maven_dependencies
text:
To learn all goals available in the maven plugin read Yupiik Tools Maven Plugin dedicated page.
Mojo can be chained from the command like - without pom declaration.
This is the case of the git report one and PDF one for example:
You can enable latex formula support in PDF adding the related dependency:
Then usage is as follow:
You can render an asciidoctor file without a pom nor pom declaration:
minisite can push the minisite to a remote target (often git backed pages). Here is the related documentation.
The configuration supports a git entry if you want to upload to a Git branch the generated website (like gh-pages):
Name
Type
Description
branch
String
Git branch to update (default to refs/heads/gh-pages).
username
Username if serverId is not set.
password
Password if serverId is not set.
serverId
ServerID to use to get username/password from settings.xml - default to project.scm.url. If not set it fallbacks on the git url host. If using a git url which is a SSH one, you can set passphrase and privateKey location in the server.
url
Git url.
ignore
boolean
Should the execution be skipped - enables to set a maven variable.
prefix
Prefix prepended to file in the git repo (ex: public/).
noJekyll
Will force a .nojekyll file presence if true.
envBase64SshKey
Environment variable the private key will be read as base64 encoded from - useful on CI. note that <value>_PH environment variable must contain the associated passphrase.
The configuration also supports an experimental Atlassian Confluence export support. It only works using the default template and require a configuration similar to git or ftp exports:
the nested support of this exporter is very experimental, and we recommend you to keep only one level of .adoc files using it.
Assets are not uploaded so ensure to configure Asciidoctor to embed all assets in HTML,
It only works with the default theme since we extract metadata from there to enable to update the space,
To look nice, you can need to tune the Confluence space CSS to import admonitions, codeblocks, … styling (can require some admin permissions).
Blog is supported if pages contain at least one block metadata. Here is the list of available attributes you can use:
:minisite-blog-published-date: yyyy-MM-dd: when the page will be rendered (if not set it is always rendered).
:minisite-blog-categories: c1,c2: comma separated list of categories of this post
:minisite-blog-authors: My, Myself: comma separated list of author names
:minisite-blog-summary: Some short description.: the summary of this post used on post list pages.
Blog page example:
Pre actions enables to generate some content from the project. It is typically used to generate configuration from code or things like that. It uses the documentation module classpath. Actions must implement Runnable and can have some (public) constructor parameters (we use parameter names to match so ensure to enable -parameters in maven compiler plugin):
configuration (Map<String, String>): the action configuration, it enables to reuse it if needed or write generic actions
sourceBase (Path): the base directory you can generate .adoc into (generally where you sources are, tip: use generated folder to be able to exclude it in .gitignore if desired)
outputBase (Path): the base directory you can generate direct html assets
Using type=maven-plugin (recommended) or type=io.yupiik.maven.service.action.builtin.MojoDocumentationGeneration you can get a plugin.xml file parsed to generate:
One file per goal with some usage, the goal description and parameters (named <goal>.adoc)
One file listing all goals (named <goal-prefix>-maven-plugin.adoc)
The configuration of this action is:
pluginXml: file path or resource to find the plugin.xml file.
toBase: where to generate the adoc.
description: a global plugin description for the "listing" page (default is empty and page will just list goals).
Using type=copy (recommended) or type=io.yupiik.maven.service.action.builtin.CopyFile will copy a file from a source to a destination: It is typically useful for assets (openapi.json for example).
from: source file.
to: destination.
Using type=jsonschema (recommended) or type=io.yupiik.maven.service.action.builtin.JsonSchemaGenerator will generate a JSON-Schema from a class:
class: the class to generate the schema from.
to: destination of the schema.
type: JSON for a raw JSON-Schema (default) or ADOC for a textual, asciidoctor output.
setClassAsTitle: true to force object title to be the class name.
useReflectionForDefaults: true to force reflection to try to extract defaults of attributes.
pretty when type=JSON, should the JSON be prettified or not (default=true).
levelPrefix when type=ADOC, a title prefix (== for example), = by default.
title and description enable to set class title/description for its json schema. It is required for type=ADOC.
annotationOnlyProvidesTheDescription enable to never take the title from an annotation (@Description(value) case).
the model classes can use a custom @Description(title,description) annotation (note that @Doc is also supported and value method can be used instead of description). See JsonDocExtractor for more details.
Using type=openmetrics2adoc (recommended) or type=io.yupiik.tools.minisite.action.builtin.OpenMetricsToAsciidoc will generate an asciidoctor form from an OpenMetrics export.
source: path of the openmetrics dump.
to: destination of the asciidoc generated from source.
levelPrefix: a prefix set before the part title (`== ` by default for a second level title).
legend: should tables have a legend (name of the metric), default to true.
header: prefix the whole rendering (enables to set a title and some options if needed).
Using type=simple-configuration (recommended) or type=io.yupiik.tools.minisite.action.builtin.SimpleConfigurationGenerator will generate an asciidoctor from a configuration class passed in class <configuration> option.
class: root configuration fully qualified name.
output: where to generate the .adoc to.
Using type=replace-in-file (recommended) or type=io.yupiik.tools.minisite.action.builtin.ReplaceInFile will rewrite a text file replacing a string by another one.
source: file to rewrite.
token: text to replace.
replacement: text replacing token.
using regex{xxx} as token will use a java regex to do the replacement.
Some specific attributes enables to customize the generation. Here is their list:
minisite-skip=[true|false] enables to skip a .adoc rendering even if not in _partials directory.
minisite-path=<string> enables to force the relative path of the file, for example a file name foo-bar.adoc with the attribute minisite-path set to foo/bar.html will output a foo/bar.html file instead of foo-bar.html. Note however it does not rewrite the links to ensure to use …..html instead of ref to link this page then.
minisite-highlightjs-skip enables to not setup highlight.js for the page (useful with swagger-ui for example).
To include a page in the index it must contain minisite-index attribute. Its value is the order of the entry in the index tiles.
ensure to not use 1, 2, 3, … but rather 100, 200, … to easily insert an item later.
minisite-index-title attribute enables to override link text.
minisite-index-icon attribute enables to override font awesome icon (without fa- prefix).
minisite-index-description attribute enables to override the text in the index tile for the page entry.
Then run mvn yupiik-tools:synchronize-github-releases.
script-cli-skeleton enables to generates a skeleton layout to write a CLI in bash (helper commands for your project).
can be used on a pomless project: mvn io.yupiik.maven:yupiik-tools-maven-plugin:<version>:script-cli-skeleton -Dyupiik.script-cli-skeleton.directory=/path/to/script-project (version >= 1.0.26).
To add a command:
Create an index.sh containing the command script in commands folder
(optional) create a commands/<your command name>/_cli/help.txt file containing the help description.
The project adds asciidoc macros to get back some maven build information. Note that it must be executed in the right lifecycle phase if using some project metadata (plugin does not require any resolution to be usable standalone).
Enables to list the project dependencies.
Scope can be:
compile
runtime
compile+runtime
runtime+system
test
provided_only
compile_only
test_only
system_only
runtime_only
The optional attribute groupId is also supported and take a list (comma separated) of groupId to include.
This extension sets up the equivalent of a parent pom but enables to inherit or not from another parent and to benefit from upgrades for free.
It is configured in the root project through maven properties:
Just enabling this extension will upgrade a few plugin, enforce the encoding and java version, enforce license check and much more.
See io.yupiik.maven.extension.YupiikOSSExtension.afterProjectsRead for details.
It enables to put in each module a YupiikContributor.java file which will be compiled and executed in afterProjectRead(MavenSession) callback.
Example:
This enables to programmatically handle the pom (mainly intended for plugins since dependencies are not synchronized in maven poms when contributed this way).
To enable it, enable the related extension:
see io.yupiik.maven.extension.YupiikOSSExtension for a more complex participant example.
title: Maven

text:
audit: custom attributes. By default _partials and images folders are set to partialsdir and imagesdir attributes.
cucumber2asciidoc: convert cucumber JSON report(s) into an asciidoc file which can be rendered with PDF or HTML goals.
git-report: generates a report from a .git folder.
inject-version: injects a select in an already generated website - like minisite one - enabling to switch between listed version from a folder. It can be combined with some javascript to switch between the websites without regenerating everything.
minisite: minisite goal. Enables to generate a small website. It needs a "documentation" module, it uses the following default layout:
src/main/doc/content: contains a set of .adoc (converted to .html)
src/main/doc/assets: contains a set of files moved "as this" to site output directory (css, js)
src/main/doc/templates: contains the templates for the layout and pages of the website
pdf: custom attributes. By default _partials and images folders are set to partialsdir and imagesdir attributes.
script-cli-skeleton: seed a simple bash CLI.
serve-minisite: minisite goa with HTTP server.
serve-slides: custom attributes.
slides: custom attributes.
synchronize-github-releases: fetch versions of the defined artifacts on a nexus and ensures it is set as github release artifacts.
watch-pdf: custom attributes. By default _partials and images folders are set to partialsdir and imagesdir attributes.
title: Yupiik-tools Maven Plugin

text:
Custom attributes. By default _partials and images folders are set to partialsdir and imagesdir attributes.
To call this goal from the command line execute: mvn yupiik-tools:audit.
To bind this goal in the build you can use:
You can execute this goal particularly with mvn yupiik-tools:audit@my-execution command.
Warning: this must be a shared settings by all executions. Override defaults require - completely.
Source directory or file to render, if a directory all files with extension .adoc will be selected. Default value: ${project.basedir}/src/main/pdf. Property: ${yupiik.pdf.source}.
Where to render the asciidoc files to. Default value: ${project.build.directory}/yupiik/pdf. Property: ${yupiik.pdf.target}.
Theme directory (name of the theme is yupiik), let it null to inherit from the default theme. Property: ${yupiik.pdf.themeDir}.
Where to extract files needed for the rendering. Default value: ${project.build.directory}/yupiik-workdir. Property: ${yupiik.workDir}.
title: yupiik-tools:audit

text:
Convert cucumber JSON report(s) into an asciidoc file which can be rendered with PDF or HTML goals.
To call this goal from the command line execute: mvn yupiik-tools:cucumber2asciidoc.
To bind this goal in the build you can use:
You can execute this goal particularly with mvn yupiik-tools:cucumber2asciidoc@my-execution command.
Default value: = Cucumber Report. Property: ${yupiik.cucumber.prefix}.
Default value: ${project.build.directory/cucumber-reports/. Property: ${yupiik.cucumber.source}.
Property: ${yupiik.cucumber.suffix}.
Default value: ${project.build.directory}/generated-adoc/cucumber.report.adoc. Property: ${yupiik.cucumber.target}.
title: yupiik-tools:cucumber2asciidoc

text:
Generates a report from a .git folder.
To call this goal from the command line execute: mvn yupiik-tools:git-report.
To bind this goal in the build you can use:
You can execute this goal particularly with mvn yupiik-tools:git-report@my-execution command.
* means the parameter is required.
"Where .git folder to analyze is. Property: ${yupiik.git-report.dotGit}.
Options to filter the git log value. Property: ${yupiik.git-report.filters}.
How to format a log line if the renderer needs to. Property: ${yupiik.git-report.logFormat}.
If true existing report is overwritten else it fails if it already exists. Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.git-report.overwrite}.
Kind of rendering. Default value: DEFAULT. Property: ${yupiik.git-report.renderer}.
Where to write the report. Default value: ${project.build.directory}/yupiik-git/report.adoc. Property: ${yupiik.git-report.target}.
Report title. Default value: Report. Property: ${yupiik.git-report.title}.
title: yupiik-tools:git-report

text:
Injects a select in an already generated website - like minisite one - enabling to switch between listed version from a folder. It can be combined with some javascript to switch between the websites without regenerating everything.
To call this goal from the command line execute: mvn yupiik-tools:inject-version.
To bind this goal in the build you can use:
You can execute this goal particularly with mvn yupiik-tools:inject-version@my-execution command.
* means the parameter is required.
String to locate and replace in the source files, can use a regex if prefixed with regex:. Property: ${yupiik.inject-version.replacedString}.
String to inject into the output. <!-- generated_versions_select -→ is replaced by a select with one option per version found. Property: ${yupiik.inject-version.replacingContent}.
Source folder with the website to inject version to. Property: ${yupiik.inject-version.source}.
Root folder containing all versions. Property: ${yupiik.inject-version.versionFolderParent}.
Website encoding. Default value: ${project.build.sourceEncoding}. Property: ${yupiik.inject-version.target}.
List of exclusions (for file processing). Similar to includes but enables to force an exclusion. Property: ${yupiik.inject-version.excludes}.
Enables to ignore some matching (to the pattern) version folders. Property: ${yupiik.inject-version.ignoredVersionFolders}.
Should the output be written in source (and target be ignored). Default value: false. Property: ${yupiik.inject-version.inPlace}.
List of inclusions (for file processing). It is a list of file names (not path) or regex if prefixed with regex:. Default value: regex:.+\.html. Property: ${yupiik.inject-version.includes}.
Attributes to inject to the <select> when <!-- generated_versions_select -→ is used. Property: ${yupiik.inject-version.selectProperties}.
Output folder if not inplace. Property: ${yupiik.inject-version.target}.
Pattern to match version folders in versionFolderParent. Default value: v?\p{Digit}+\.\p{Digit}+(\.\p{Digit}+?(\-[a-zA-Z0-9]+)?). Property: ${yupiik.inject-version.versionFoldersPattern}.
title: yupiik-tools:inject-version

text:
Minisite goal. Enables to generate a small website.
It needs a "documentation" module, it uses the following default layout:
src/main/doc/content: contains a set of .adoc (converted to .html)
src/main/doc/assets: contains a set of files moved "as this" to site output directory (css, js)
src/main/doc/templates: contains the templates for the layout and pages of the website
To call this goal from the command line execute: mvn yupiik-tools:minisite.
To bind this goal in the build you can use:
You can execute this goal particularly with mvn yupiik-tools:minisite@my-execution command.
Should blog categories pages be added to home page. Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.addIndexRegistrationPerCategory}.
Asciidoctor extensions to register in Asciidoctor instance. Can be in target/classes.
Asciidoctor attributes.
Enables to customize how categories are shown on home page.
For blog generated pages, the number of items to keep per page. Default value: 10. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.blogPageSize}.
Max date until when posts are published. today and infinite are supported as dynamic alias. Using default the minisite rendering uses today and the serve mode uses infinite to get local previews. Default value: default. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.blogPublicationDate}.
target/classes for pre-actions if needed. Default value: ${project.build.outputDirectory}. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.classes}.
copyright value in the footer when using default theme. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.copyright}.
Custom head links (to add custom css easily). Property: ${yupiik.minisite.customHead}.
Custom html template for menus. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.customMenu}.
Custom scripts links (to add custom js easily). Property: ${yupiik.minisite.customScripts}.
Default HTML page description. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.description}.
Artifacts to ignore in the classloader loading asciidoctor extensions and preactions. Default value: org.asciidoctor:asciidoctorj. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.excludedArtifacts}.
Generate blog pages if it has some blog entries - skipped otherwise. Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.generateBlog}.
Generate index page. Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.generateIndex}.
Generate sitemap page (xml). Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.generateSiteMap}.
Gravatar configuration.
Should asciidoctor extensions and preactions be loaded with the provided dependencies in the classloader or not. Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.includeProvidedScope}.
When index is generated the content page title. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.indexSubTitle}.
When index is generated the content page title. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.indexText}.
Add reading time on blog pages. Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.injectBlogMeta}.
Use yupiik theme. Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.injectYupiikTemplateExtensionPoints}.
linkedInCompany name (in linkedin url). Default value: yupiik. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.linkedInCompany}.
Logo url. Default value: //www.yupiik.com/img/favicon.png. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.logo}.
Text next to the logo text. Default value: Docs. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.logoSideText}.
Default logo text for default template. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.logoText}.
Actions to execute before any rendering. Typically used to generate some content.
Warning: this must be a shared settings by all executions. Override defaults require - completely.
Should page sorting be reversed (by published date). Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.reverseBlogOrder}.
RSS feed location (relative to the output) if set. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.rssFeedFile}.
Generate search json. Default value: search.json. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.searchIndexName}.
Default HTML page description. Default value: http://localhost:4200. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.siteBase}.
Skip mojo execution. Default value: false. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.skip}.
Should Documentation title suffix be skipped. Default value: false. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.skipIndexTitleDocumentationText}.
Skip site rendering. Default value: false. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.skipRendering}.
Where to read content (layout root) from. Default value: ${project.basedir}/src/main/minisite. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.source}.
Where to generate the site. Default value: ${project.build.directory}/${project.build.finalName}. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.target}.
Should left menu (global navigation) be added from index links. Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.addLeftMenu}.
Template directory if set. Property: ${yupiik.slides.templateDirs}.
Custom default theme extension points. An extension point is a placeholder in a template surrounded by 3 braces: {{{xyz}} }. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.templateExtensionPoints}.
Template file name added before the content. Default value: header.html,menu.html. Property: ``.
Template file name added after the content. Default value: footer-top.html,footer-end.html. Property: ``.
Default HTML page title. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.title}.
Use default assets. Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.useDefaultAssets}.
A boolean or auto (= if asciidoctorExtensions is not empty it behaves as true) to use the plugin classloader as parent for preaction and asciidoctor extension or not. Default value: auto. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.usePluginAsParentClassLoader}.
Where to extract files needed for the rendering. Default value: ${project.build.directory}/yupiik-workdir. Property: ${yupiik.workDir}.
title: yupiik-tools:minisite

Seed a simple bash CLI.

* means the parameter is required.
Where to create the bash CLI skeleton. Property: ${yupiik.script-cli-skeleton.directory}.
Where to create the bash CLI skeleton. Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.script-cli-skeleton.generateHelloWorldCommand}.

copyright value in the footer when using default theme. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.copyright}.
Custom head links (to add custom css easily). Property: ${yupiik.minisite.customHead}.

Artifacts to ignore in the classloader loading asciidoctor extensions and preactions. Default value: org.asciidoctor:asciidoctorj. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.excludedArtifacts}.
Generate blog pages if it has some blog entries - skipped otherwise. Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.generateBlog}.
Generate index page. Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.generateIndex}.
Generate sitemap page (xml). Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.generateSiteMap}.
Gravatar configuration.
Should asciidoctor extensions and preactions be loaded with the provided dependencies in the classloader or not. Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.includeProvidedScope}.
When index is generated the content page title. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.indexSubTitle}.

Add reading time on blog pages. Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.injectBlogMeta}.
Use yupiik theme. Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.injectYupiikTemplateExtensionPoints}.
linkedInCompany name (in linkedin url). Default value: yupiik. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.linkedInCompany}.
Logo url. Default value: //www.yupiik.com/img/favicon.png. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.logo}.

Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.openBrowser}.
Which port to bind. Default value: 4200. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.port}.
Actions to execute before any rendering. Typically used to generate some content.
Warning: this must be a shared settings by all executions. Override defaults require - completely.
Should page sorting be reversed (by published date). Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.reverseBlogOrder}.

Skip site rendering. Default value: false. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.skipRendering}.

A boolean or auto (= if asciidoctorExtensions is not empty it behaves as true) to use the plugin classloader as parent for preaction and asciidoctor extension or not. Default value: auto. Property: ${yupiik.minisite.usePluginAsParentClassLoader}.
How long to wait to check if render must be re-done in watch mode (in ms). Default value: 150. Property: ${yupiik.slides.watchDelay}.

title: yupiik-tools:serve-minisite

text:
Custom attributes.
To call this goal from the command line execute: mvn yupiik-tools:serve-slides.
To bind this goal in the build you can use:
You can execute this goal particularly with mvn yupiik-tools:serve-slides@my-execution command.
Custom css if needed, overrides default one. Property: ${yupiik.slides.customCss}.
Custom js if needed. Property: ${yupiik.slides.customScripts}.
Which execution mode to use, WATCH and SERVE are for dev purposes. Default value: DEFAULT. Property: ${yupiik.slides.mode}.
Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.slides.openBrowser}.
For SERVE mode, which port to bind. Default value: 4200. Property: ${yupiik.slides.serve.port}.
Warning: this must be a shared settings by all executions. Override defaults require - completely.
Which renderer (slide) to use. Default value: BESPOKE_ENRICHED. Property: ${yupiik.slides.slider}.
Slide deck source file. Default value: ${project.basedir}/src/main/slides/index.adoc. Property: ${yupiik.slides.source}.
Synchronize folders.
Where to render the slide deck. Default value: ${project.build.directory}/yupiik/slides. Property: ${yupiik.slides.target}.
Template directory if set. Property: ${yupiik.slides.templateDirs}.
How long to wait to check if render must be re-done in watch mode (in ms). Default value: 150. Property: ${yupiik.slides.watchDelay}.
Where to extract files needed for the rendering. Default value: ${project.build.directory}/yupiik-workdir. Property: ${yupiik.workDir}.
title: yupiik-tools:serve-slides

text:
Fetch versions of the defined artifacts on a nexus and ensures it is set as github release artifacts.
To call this goal from the command line execute: mvn yupiik-tools:synchronize-github-releases.
To bind this goal in the build you can use:
You can execute this goal particularly with mvn yupiik-tools:synchronize-github-releases@my-execution command.
Property: ${yupiik.synchronize-github-releases.artifacts}.
Default value: false. Property: ${yupiik.synchronize-github-releases.attachIfExists}.
Property: ${yupiik.synchronize-github-releases.dryRun}.
Default value: false. Property: ${yupiik.synchronize-github-releases.force}.
Default value: true. Property: ${yupiik.synchronize-github-releases.forceHttpV1}.
Default value: https://api.github.com/. Property: ${yupiik.synchronize-github-releases.githubRepository}.
Property: ${yupiik.synchronize-github-releases.githubRepository}.
Default value: github.com. Property: ${yupiik.synchronize-github-releases.githubServerId}.
Default value: https://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2/. Property: ${yupiik.synchronize-github-releases.mavenRepositoryBaseUrl}.
Property: ${yupiik.synchronize-github-releases.nexusServerId}.
Property: ${yupiik.synchronize-github-releases.tagPattern}.
Default value: 16. Property: ${yupiik.synchronize-github-releases.threads}.
Default value: ${project.build.directory}/synchronize-github-releases-workdir. Property: ${yupiik.synchronize-github-releases.workdir}.
title: yupiik-tools:synchronize-github-releases

text:
Custom attributes. By default _partials and images folders are set to partialsdir and imagesdir attributes.
To call this goal from the command line execute: mvn yupiik-tools:watch-pdf.
To bind this goal in the build you can use:
You can execute this goal particularly with mvn yupiik-tools:watch-pdf@my-execution command.
How long to pause between two check to see if sources must be re-rendered. Default value: 1000. Property: ${yupiik.pdf.pauseBetweenChecks}.
Warning: this must be a shared settings by all executions. Override defaults require - completely.
Source directory or file to render, if a directory all files with extension .adoc will be selected. Default value: ${project.basedir}/src/main/pdf. Property: ${yupiik.pdf.source}.
Where to render the asciidoc files to. Default value: ${project.build.directory}/yupiik/pdf. Property: ${yupiik.pdf.target}.
Theme directory (name of the theme is yupiik), let it null to inherit from the default theme. Property: ${yupiik.pdf.themeDir}.
Where to extract files needed for the rendering. Default value: ${project.build.directory}/yupiik-workdir. Property: ${yupiik.workDir}.
title: yupiik-tools:watch-pdf
